attributes.action: Make it illegal for shops to advertise Christmas until 25 November.
attributes.background:
I love Christmas; most people do. However, I hate the way it is commercialised in early November each year so is dragged out for eight weeks, resulting in the big day ending in an anti-climax.

Let's change this by giving shops one month to do all they need.

rejection.details:
The Government is not directly responsible for advertising. All forms of advertising in the UK are regulated by the Advertising Standards Authority (ASA), who impose the British Advertising Codes.

You can find out more about the ASA here:

https://www.asa.org.uk/
